00029   class StaticBuffer {
00030   public:
00031 
00032     StaticBuffer(void *data, uint32_t len, bool take_ownership=true) :
00033         base((uint8_t *)data), size(len), own(take_ownership) { }
00034 
00035     StaticBuffer() : base(0), size(0), own(true) { }
00036 
00037     StaticBuffer(DynamicBuffer &dbuf) {
00038       base = dbuf.base;
00039       size = dbuf.fill();
00040       own = dbuf.own;
00041       if (own) {
00042         dbuf.base = dbuf.ptr = 0;
00043         dbuf.size = 0;
00044       }
00045     }
00046 
00047     ~StaticBuffer() {
00048       if (own)
00049         delete [] base;
00050     }
00051 
00062     StaticBuffer(StaticBuffer& other) {
00063       base = other.base;
00064       size = other.size;
00065       own = other.own;
00066       if (own) {
00067         other.own = false;
00068         other.base = 0;
00069       }
00070     }
00071

00083       base = other.base;

00085       own = other.own;
00086       if (own) {
00087         other.own = false;
00088         other.base = 0;
00089       }
00090       return *this;
00091     }
00092

00098       size = dbuf.fill();
00099       own = dbuf.own;
00100       if (own) {
00101         dbuf.base = dbuf.ptr = 0;

00106 
00107     void set(uint8_t *data, uint32_t len, bool take_ownership=true) {
00108       base = data;
00109       size = len;
00110       own = take_ownership;
00111     }
